articles.title: Kim Jong Il Enjoys Concert Given on New Year
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Enjoys Concert Given on New Year
						
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il enjoyed together with senior officials of the party, state and army a concert given by the Unhasu Orchestra at the Mansudae Art Theatre on Dec. 30 on the occasion of the New Year.
					 The performance began with the playing of the national anthem. Put on the stage were female solo and chorus "Song of Loyalty", chorus "My Country that Witnesses Dramatic Changes," male solo and chorus "Song of Airman," orchestra "A Young Engine Driver" and other colorful numbers.
					
					 The performers sang with high pride of the path of great victory along which the country has dashed like the wind towards the eminence of a thriving nation, holding high the torch lit by Kim Jong Il in Kangson.
					
					 Kim Jong Il expressed great satisfaction over the successful concert given by the artistes as it is clear in its ideological and thematic import and vividly reflects the aspiration and desire of the Korean people. He highly appreciated the success made in the performance and extended thanks to them.
					
					 He noted that the enthusiasm of the army and people of the DPRK is exceptionally high as they greet the New Year with the great pride and honor of being victors, expressing expectation and conviction that the whole party and army and all the people would bring about a great innovation and leap forward in the worthwhile drive in the new year, too, and thus glorify 2010 as a year of great victory to be eternally recorded in the history of the country. 
					
					 Among the audience were Kim Yong Nam, Kim Yong Il and other senior officials of the party, state and army, leading officials of the party, armed forces and power organs, working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, officials in the fields of science, education, culture and arts, public health and media and servicepersons of the Korean People's Army.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets to Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Greets to Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il together with Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Raul Castro Ruz, second secretary of the C.C., the Communist Party of Cuba, President of the Council of State and President of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, on Thursday on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the victorious Cuban revolution.
					 The message said:
					
					 We, on behalf of the Workers' Party of Korea and the government and the people of the DPRK, extend warm congratulations to you and the Communist Party of Cuba and the Cuban government and people on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the victory in the Cuban revolution.
					
					 Availing ourselves of this opportunity to express belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the parties, governments and peoples of the two countries would grow stronger in the future, we heartily wish you and your people greater successes in the work for the development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Floral Basket to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a floral basket to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the victorious Cuban revolution.
					 The basket was handed to Bianka Rodriguez Suero, charge d'affaires ad interim of the embassy, on Thursday.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam sends Message of Sympathy to Indonesian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam sends Message of Sympathy to Indonesian President
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, on Thursday sent a message of sympathy to Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono, Indonesian President, in connection with the fact that Abdurrahman Wahid, former Indonesian president, died of illness.
					 Kim in the message expressed deep condolences and sympathy to the President and, through him, to the bereaved family of the deceased.

articles.title: Cuban Military Attache Gives Reception
articles.content:
Cuban Military Attache Gives Reception
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Military Attache of the Cuban embassy here Leonardo Perez Mesa gave a reception at the Taedonggang Diplomatic Corps Club on Wednesday on the occasion of the 53rd anniversary of the revolutionary armed forces of Cuba.
					 Present there on invitation were general officers and officers of the Korean People's Army, officials concerned and diplomatic envoys and military attaches of various countries here.
					
					 Bianka Rodriguez Suero, charge d'affaires ad interim, and other officials of the Cuban embassy here were on hand.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: Floral Baskets Sent to Cuban Embassy
articles.content:
Floral Baskets Sent to Cuban Embassy
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Ministries and national institution of the DPRK sent floral baskets to the Cuban embassy here on the occasion of the 51st anniversary of the victory in the Cuban revolution.
					 The floral baskets in the names of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the Ministry of Foreign Trade and the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries were conveyed to Bianka Rodriguez Suero, charge d'affaires ad interim of the Cuban embassy, on Dec. 31.

articles.title: Chinese Ambassador Gives Reception on Occasion of New Year
articles.content:
Chinese Ambassador Gives Reception on Occasion of New Year
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Liu Xiaoming, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK, arranged a reception at his embassy on Wednesday on the occasion of the New Year.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly, Choe Chang Sik, minister of Public Health who is chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK-China Friendship Association, Kang Nung Su, minister of Culture, Kim Hyong Jun, vice-minister of Foreign Affairs, Ku Pon Thae, vice-minister of Foreign Trade, Ryang Hak Sun, vice-minister of Education, Jon Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and officials concerned.
					
					 Staff members of the Chinese embassy were on hand.
					
					 Speaking at the reception, Liu Xiaoming referred to the fact that high-level intercourse has been briskly conducted between the two countries this year marking the 60th anniversary of the establishment of their diplomatic ties.
					
					 Exchanges and cooperation between the two countries have been further promoted in all fields under the deep care of their top leaders, he noted.
					
					 He said that the Korean people have made long strides in their drive to open the gate to a great prosperous and powerful nation under the leadership of General Secretary Kim Jong Il and the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 He heartily hoped that the Korean people would achieve greater success under the leadership of Kim Jong Il in the new year marking the 65th anniversary of the WPK.
					
					 Yang Hyong Sop said in his speech that the solidity of the traditional DPRK-China friendship has been displayed through the observance of "year of DPRK-China friendship" this year.
					
					 The bilateral friendship provided by revolutionaries of the elder generation is a common treasure, he noted.
					
					 He sincerely hoped that the Chinese people would make bigger successes in the future under the leadership of the Communist Party of China with Hu Jintao as its general secretary.
					
					 He expressed belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would be strengthened in conformity with the desire and interests of the two peoples by their joint efforts in the new year, too.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Chinese consul-general in Chongjin gave a reception on the same occasion that day.
					
					 Earlier, on Dec. 28 Liu Xiaoming hosted a party at the embassy for officials of the DPRK Foreign Ministry.

articles.title: Concert Given on Occasion of New Year
articles.content:
Concert Given on Occasion of New Year
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- A concert was given by the Samjiyon Band of the Mansudae Art Troupe at the East Pyongyang Grand Theatre on Dec. 31 on the occasion of the New Year, Juche 99 (2010).
					 It was appreciated by senior officials of the party, army and state, the chairpersons of the friendly parties, leading officials of working people's organizations, ministries and national institutions, servicepersons of the Korean People's Army and working people in Pyongyang.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the chief of the Pyongyang Mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front, overseas Koreans visiting the socialist homeland, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here and other foreigners.
					
					 The concert began with prelude "Happy New Year." Put on the stage were instrumental music and song the immortal classic masterpiece "Greeting the Sun Rising over the Taedong River", instrumental music and song "The Leader's Noble Intention Came into full Bloom," music "May Chollima of Songun Korea Gallop", instrumental music and song "Push Back the Frontiers of Science" and other colorful numbers.
					
					The performers sang high praises of the intense loyalty and immortal exploits General Secretary Kim Jong Il has performed by successfully realizing the life-long desire of President Kim Il Sung with his unique Songun revolutionary leadership.

articles.title: Memorial Stamps Issued
articles.content:
Memorial Stamps Issued in DPRK
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The Democratic People's Republic of Korea has brought out new stamps (a souvenir sheet and a sheetlet) in remembrance of Juche 98 (2009) when the Korean people's dreams have come true.
					 The souvenir sheet contains a Korean painting of General Secretary Kim Jong Il visiting the Chollima Steel Complex in December last year to kindle a torchlight of a new great revolutionary upsurge.
					
					 Seen in the sheetlet are individual stamps showing the successful launch of artificial satellite "Kwangmyongsong-2" by the Korean people themselves, completion of a Juche-oriented steel production system at the Songjin Steel Complex, CNC technology fully grasped by Korean technicians and other conspicuous achievements made in the efforts for building a great, prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: Vanguard of Revolutionary Upsurge
articles.content:
Vanguard of Revolutionary Upsurge
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Soldier-constructers of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea have built many monumental structures in the Songun era under the slogan "Let's take charge of both national defense and socialist construction!"
					Taking the lead in building a great, prosperous and powerful nation as standard-bearers of the Songun revolution, they completed the Nyongwon Power Station project and created a new Chollima speed called "Huichon Speed" in the construction of the Huichon Power Station with a heroic mettle and revolutionary spirit of self-reliance.
					
					 In response to the noble intention of the Workers' Party of Korea to bring about a radical turn in the people's living, officers of the Ministry of People's Security and soldier-constructors under the ministry have finished the enormous project of the well-arranged Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm in a matter of months.
					
					 Soldier-constructors have also built the well-equipped Taedonggang Foodstuff Factory, Pyongyang Chewing Gum Factory, Pothonggang Shop, Taedonggang Tile Factory, a goat farm turning out various kinds of processed milk and so on to meet the requirements of the new century. They are now taking part in the construction of dwelling houses for 100,000 families in Pyongyang.
					
					The newly built swimming complex of Kim Il Sung University, Honored Red Flag Sojung Secondary School in Rakwon County, Kalma Theater and Majon Hotel and reconstructed Pyongyang Grand Theater and tramcar track between Mangyongdae and Pyongyang Railway Station are all associated with the firm determination of the soldier-constructors to implement at any cost the intention of General Secretary Kim Jong Il to provide the people with better educational and cultural conditions. Now the construction of Pyongyang Folk Park and reconstruction of Kaeson Youth Park are progressing apace thanks to their devoted efforts.
					
					 Under the energetic guidance of Kim Jong Il the servicepersons have played a big role as main force of the revolution, blazing up the flame of a new revolutionary upsurge in the building of a great, prosperous and powerful nation.

articles.title: World Peace-Loving Forces Called upon to Strengthen Unity
articles.content:
World Peace-Loving Forces Called upon to Strengthen Unity
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- It is necessary for all the progressives of the world to get united in order to ensure the victory of anti-imperialist and independent forces and accomplish the cause of peace in the struggle against the imperialists, says Rodong Sinmun Thursday in a signed article. 
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is possible to successfully avert a war and preserve peace if the world progressive people turn out in the struggle for protecting peace from imperialism while solidarizing and uniting with one another under the uplifted banner of unity. 
					
					 The world peace-loving forces should unite on the principle of independence and the might of this unity should be displayed in the anti-imperialist struggle.
					
					 What is most important in the struggle to defend peace is to struggle against the imperialists' high-handed and arbitrary practices. The world peace-loving people should weaken the imperialists as much as possible and dismember them through counteroffensives against them in every part of the world.
					
					 The progressives should never harbor illusion about imperialism as it is little short of giving up the anti-imperialist struggle.
					
					 It is the consistent policy of the DPRK to struggle against the imperialists' aggression and war moves in firm unity with the world progressives in the idea of independence, peace and friendship.
					
					 The Korean people will wage a more dynamic struggle against imperialists and war under the prevailing situation and thus ensure peace and security on the Korean Peninsula and make positive contributions to realizing humankind's desire for peace, concludes the article.

articles.title: S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Moves to Suppress Labor Movement Flailed
articles.content:
S. Korean Puppet Authorities' Moves to Suppress Labor Movement Flailed
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Confederation of Trade Unions held a press conference in Seoul on Dec. 28 at which it denounced the puppet authorities for their moves to suppress the labor movement, according to the south Korean KBS.
					 The organization charged at the press conference that the authorities' moves to pass a "draft amendment to the law on trade unions" which calls for disallowing the payment of wages to the full- time trade union leaders, etc. are aimed at suppressing the workers' rights and holding in check the trade union activities, demanding the authorities immediately stop such action.
					
					 The organization warned that if the authorities enforce such anti-workers law defying their protest, it will call a general strike at once.

articles.title: Puppet Authorities' Move for "Improvement of Four Big Rivers" Protested
articles.content:
Puppet Authorities' Move for "Improvement of Four Big Rivers" Protested
 Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Labor Party and other opposition parties of south Korea staged a sit-in strike at the "National Assembly" on Dec. 28 in denunciation of the puppet authorities' move for "improving four big rivers", according to KBS of south Korea.
					 They accused the "Grand National Party" of behaving arbitrarily at the "NA examination of the budget" in a bid to spend a stupendous amount of funds for the "improvement of four big rivers."
					
					 They demanded the authorities stop threatening the people under the pretext of "budget" and give up at once all the preparations for the projects.

articles.title: Exploits of Peerlessly Great Persons Praised
articles.content:
Exploits of Peerlessly Great Persons Praised
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Meetings, film shows and photo exhibitions were held in South Africa and Bangladesh and a seminar in Mexico between December 12 and 14 to mark the 18th anniversary of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's assumption of the supreme commandership of the Korean People's Army and the 92nd birth anniversary of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese heroine.
					 On display in the venues of the functions were photos on the immortal exploits of Kim Jong Il and Kim Jong Suk, woman commander of Mt. Paektu, and photos introducing the Korean people in the efforts to build a great prosperous and powerful nation.
					
					 Appreciated at the film shows were "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation" and other Korean films.
					
					 Speeches were made at the functions.
					
					 The chairman of the Mahlambandlophy, Pretoria City, Branch of the African National Congress of South Africa said that the Korean people have achieved marvelous successes beyond imagination in the drive to build a thriving nation. The credit for the DPRK's rapid advance toward brilliant future goes to the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il who has made endless forced march of field guidance, pursuing the Songun politics, he added.
					
					 The advisor of the Bangladesh Barisal Society for the Study of Songun Policy stressed that under the leadership of Kim Jong Il the Korean people have firmly defended socialism without vacillation at the persistent moves of the imperialists.
					
					 The chairman of the Mexican Institute for the Study of the Juche Idea noted that Kim Jong Suk gave birth to the bright star of Mt. Paektu and thus provided a sure guarantee for carrying forward and accomplishing the socialist cause generation after generation. Her life and feats will shine forever with Songun Korea, he said.
					
					 A message of greetings to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event in South Africa.

articles.title: Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
articles.content:
Anniversary of Kim Jong Il's Work Observed
Pyongyang, December 31 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun today dedicates a signed article to the 20th anniversary of the publication of General Secretary Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Give Full Play to the Korean Nation-First Spirit."
					 The work comprehensively deals with the essence and contents of the Korean nation-first spirit and the tasks and ways to give full play to it.
					
					 The article says:
					
					 The Korean nation-first spirit cherished by the Korean people has been more fully displayed in the advance for the great surge for achieving the final victory of the building of a thriving nation.
					
					It also finds its vivid manifestation in that the Korean people are making a leap forward in building an economic power in the Korean way by their own efforts and has firmly preserved the socialist characteristics.
					
					 It is the firm faith of the Korean people to fully demonstrate the dignity, honor, wisdom and talents of the nation and fling open the gate to a thriving nation at any cost under the leadership of the great Party.
					
					 The Korean people regard the spirit of devotedly defending the leader as a soul peculiar to the nation and the starting point of all their thinking and practices.
					
					 The slogan "Let us live our own way!" can be seen in all sites for effecting a great surge and the Korean-style mode of struggle and pattern of creation are being thoroughly applied there.
					
					 This year was clearly recorded in the history of the country as a year in which the ideals of the people come true as the servicepersons and people gave fullest play to the spirit of national self-esteem.
					
					 The Korean nation-first spirit cherished by the Korean people is the pride and self-esteem with which they live in the most advantageous socialist system in the world. 
					
					 The Korean people defended socialism to the last, braving all sorts of trials and difficulties in the "Arduous March", the forced march when they were at the crucial crossroad of defending socialism or becoming slaves of capitalism. That is why the Korean people can never abandon the socialist characteristics.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 51o aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, junto con el presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la RPDC, Kim Yong Nam, envio el dia 31 un mensaje de felicitacion a Raul Castro Ruz, Segundo Secretario del CC del Partido Comunista de Cuba y Presidente de los Consejos de Estado y de Ministros de la Republica de Cuba.
					La misiva va como sigue:
					
					Con motivo del 51o aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana, enviamos a Vd., al Partido Comunista de Cuba, al gobierno y el pueblo de la Republica de Cuba nuestras calurosas felicitaciones en nombre del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el gobierno y el pueblo de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					Aprovechamos esta oportunidad para expresar nuestra conviccion de que las tradicionales relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los partidos, los gobiernos y los pueblos de nuestros dos paises se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas en el futuro y formulamos sinceros votos por mayores exitos en los trabajos de Vd. y su pueblo para el desarrollo y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il envia cesto de flores a la embajada cubana
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il envia cesto de flores a la embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio un cesto de flores a la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea con motivo del 51o aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana.
					  El cesto de flores fue entregado este jueves a la encargada de negocios a.i. de la embajada cubana, Bianka Rodriguez Suero.

articles.title: Ministerios y organos envian cestos de flores a la embajada cubana
articles.content:
Ministerios y organos envian cestos de flores a la embajada cubana
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Los ministerios y organos centrales enviaron cestos de flores a la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea con motivo del 51o aniversario del triunfo de la Revolucion Cubana.
					Los cestos de flores a nombre del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el de Comercio Exterior y el Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero fueron entregados, respectivamente, el dia 31 a la encargada de negocios a.i. de la embajada cubana, Bianka Rodriguez Suero.

articles.title: Embajador chino ofrece banquete por el Ano Nuevo
articles.content:
Embajador chino ofrece banquete por el Ano Nuevo
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del Ano Nuevo del 99 (2010) de la Era Juche, el embajador de la Republica Popular China en Corea, Liu Xiaoming, ofrecio la vispera en su sede diplomatica un banquete.
					Al convite fueron invitados el vicepresidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema Yang Hyong Sop, el ministro de Salud Publica y presidente del Comite Central de la Asociacion de Amistad Corea-China Choe Chang Sik, el ministro de Cultura Kang Nung Su, el vicecanciller Kim Hyong Jun, el viceministro de Comercio Exterior Ku Pon Thae, la viceministra de Educacion Ryang Hak Sun, el vicepresidente del Comite de Relaciones Culturales con el Extranjero Jon Yong Jin y otros funcionarios coreanos.
					
					Estuvieron presentes los miembros de la embajada china.
					
					El embajador chino recordo en su discurso que se activaron las visitas de alto rango entre los dos paises en el presente ano en que se cumplio el aniversario 60 del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas.
					
					Dijo que bajo la profunda atencion de los maximos Dirigentes se impulsaron dinamicamente el intercambio y la cooperacion entre ambos paises en todas las ramas.
					
					Senalo que bajo la direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il y el Partido del Trabajo de Corea, el pueblo coreano logro gran avance en la lucha por abrir las puertas a la gran potencia prospera.
					
					   Subrayo que deseaba sinceramente al pueblo coreano que en pleno acato a la direccion del Secretario General Kim Jong Il logre mayores exitos en el Ano Nuevo en que se cumplira el 65o aniversario de la fundacion del PTC.
					
					Yang Hyong Sop, en su discurso, se refirio a que a traves de la gestion del "Ano de amistad Corea-China" se manifesto la solidez de la tradicional amistad entre estos dos paises.
					
					Destaco que la amistad Corea-China preparada por los revolucionarios de la generacion vieja constituye una preciosa riqueza comun.
					
					Deseo de todo corazon al pueblo chino en el futuro mayores exitos bajo la direccion del Partido Comunista de China con Hu Jintao como Secretario General.
					
					Expreso su conviccion de que las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion Corea-China se fortaleceran y se desarrollaran segun los esfuerzos comunes tambien en el Ano Nuevo, conforme a la aspiracion y el interes de los pueblos de los dos paises.
					
					Por otra parte, el mismo dia, el consul general de China en Chongjin ofrecio el banquete con motivo del Ano Nuevo.
					
					Con anterioridad, el dia 28, el embajador chino en Corea ofrecio en la sede diplomatica el banquete en honor de los funcionarios del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de Corea.

articles.title: Agregado militar cubano ofrece banquete por el Dia de las FAR
articles.content:
Agregado militar cubano ofrece banquete por el Dia de las FAR
Pyongyang, 31 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Con motivo del 53o aniversario del Dia de las Fuerzas Armadas Revolucionarias de Cuba, el agregado militar de la Embajada de la Republica de Cuba en Corea, Leonardo Perez Mesa, ofrecio el dia 30 un banquete en el Club para el Cuerpo Diplomatico Taedonggang.
					  A la ocasion fueron invitados generales y oficiales del Ejercito Popular de Corea, los funcionarios correspondientes, los representantes diplomaticos y los agregados militares de embajadas de varios paises en Corea.
					
					  Estuvieron presentes la encargada de negocios a.i Bianka Rodriguez Suero y otros miembros de la embajada cubana en Corea.
					
					  En la recepcion se pronunciaron discursos.
